blog.name: langernameohnebedeutung
blog.title: Falling for Fiction
blog.description: Eurotrash, Biomasse mit Internetanschluss, 24, she/her, living in the Rhineland near Bonn. I blog a lot about tv-shows, history, languages and the world in general. Defensive about cursive writing, corsetry and mangos. If you need anything tagged, just drop me a note. If you don't want to have something tagged and still feel like dropping a note - also drop a note. #MagnetoWasRight (#sometimes). POORYORICK on ao3

summary: Also let’s not forget that Lorna Dane in the Gifted canonically got birthday presents from Magneto.

summary: Iron Man Annual #13 1992 Assault on Armor City Part 3 Iron Man, Scarlet Witch, Darkhawk and Spider-Woman went to attack an...
caption:
Iron Man Annual #13 1992 Assault on Armor City Part 3

Iron Man, Scarlet Witch, Darkhawk and Spider-Woman went to attack an A.I.M. island. Meanwhile, the other West Coast Avengers were fighting the Hunters, the Seekers and the Raiders at Stark Enterprises.

blog.name: cyberdelph
blog.title: Delph's World
blog.description:
I love reading...I like quotes and girly stuff...

Fan of the Cut & Run Serie & MM romance. 

Also a Black Dagger Brotherhood addict and a THIRDs nerds.

My favorite TV shows are : The Vampire Diaries, Teen Wolf, Buffy the vampire Slayer, Beauty & the Beast, Nikita, Bitten, Sherlock, Almost Human,Veronica Mars, The Following, Flash,iZombie,Supernatural, Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D, MCU...

Sometimes NSFW, so be warned...

Multifandom blog - Hate free blog. 
Multi shipper - Ship all the ships...No drama zone.

summary: TITLE: Breathe WORD COUNT: 1061 PROMPT: hey man! Thanks so much for this. Could you write a Steve Rogers x trans male reader,...
body:
TITLE: Breathe

WORD COUNT: 1061

PROMPT: hey man! Thanks so much for this. Could you write a Steve Rogers x trans male reader, maybe with the reader just feeling really shitty and dysphoria hitting them hard, and Steve helps them through it?

PRONOUNS: He/Him [trans male reader]

Your hand trembles as your fist closes around the handle of your door, conveying the unease that has consumed your mind since you awoke that morning. The unease, which has settled in your stomach like a bite of a fruit that wasn’t quite ripe yet, has prevented you from doing anything truly productive throughout the course of the day. The anxiety had build up inside you, as you knew (and still do know) that the answer is not if, but when.

You pass by a mirror in your front porch, catching a brief glance of your appearance. You pause, and then take a step back to review your appearance in more detail. Your reflection looks you back in the eye, and you take note of all your features. Your eyes, which have the same gleam of your father, framed by your face, which resembles that of your mother.

You look so much like your mother! It was a phrase to which you had become intimately familiar, heard since you were a young child. It was a phrase that had once meant nothing, then had meant something, and had then become a phrase you never wanted to hear again. Of course, you love your mother, but the phrase had only reminded you often of the facial structure you didn’t possess, the facial structure that you had desperately craved as a teenager.

Those thoughts didn’t sit well. You turn away from the mirror, suddenly unable to ignore the lump in your stomach, which has turned to boiling liquid. The words, that phrase, linger in your head like a bitter aftertaste.

You gently set your bag down on the floor, making sure to not damage the items that it holds, before making your way to your couch. You place a hand on your chest, feeling your pulse - which feels as if it’s going to burst out of your chest - and to slow your breathing. Trying to distract yourself of the tenseness of your own body, your brain hyper-aware of every inch of your skin, you turn on the television.

The noise and the light of the screen do nothing to draw you into your surroundings and out of your own skin. You want desperately to concentrate on whatever is passing in the show, but your brain can’t escape the intensity of how wrong your body feels. You are only able to concentrate on your chest, and how tight the layers of clothing appear to be. You stop trying to conceal your discomfort and you begin to involuntarily shake.

You lean over, placing your head on a pillow, and allow the tears to flow freely from your eyes. A sob makes its way past your lips, but is swallowed by the surrounding noise from the television. You hadn’t realized how loud it actually was. Your shaking hand reaches the remote to turn it off.

The sound of the door opening alerts you momentarily to your surroundings. You realize a second later that Steve has arrived home. You curl into a ball, still crying, and the only thought that circles through your head is Oh my god, I can’t let him see me like this. You try and calm yourself, stop crying, but that only makes the tears flow faster, and another sob escapes from your mouth.

Steve enters the living room of the apartment, takes one glance at you, and drops his bag to rush to your side. He gingerly sits beside you, but doesn’t touch you. He sits beside you, silently, until you raise your head to look him in the eyes with your own tear-filled ones.  

“Can I touch you?” he asks gently, not breaking eye contact. You nod quickly, and then lean over to rest your head on his shoulder. He wraps his arm around your back, and he begins to gently draw circles on your skin with the tips of his fingers. You burst into tears again.

Steve kisses your forehead gently, rocking you back and forth, but it doesn’t help much. You’re still feeling uncomfortable and miserable, and while his presence is comforting, you just want to escape. Steve’s breathing is calm and steady, and you focus your mind to concentrate only on that. Your heart is still beating furiously in your chest, but you’ve managed to stop sobbing. The tears are pouring silently out of your eyes now.

“Hey, it’s ok, it’s ok,” Steve whispers, placing a hand on the back of your head. When you flinch to the feeling, his hand retracts.

“Steve,” you say between rushed breaths.

“I’m here,” he responds. “I’m right here. Don’t worry.”

You lift your head from his shoulder to then press it into his chest, feeling his heartbeat. You remark that your tears have caused his shirt to become damp. You close your eyes and feel his beating heart as his arm, wrapped around your back, continues to gently trace circles into your skin.

The two of you stay there for what feels like an eternity to you, until you raise your head and look him in the eyes.

“Are you feeling better?” he asks you.

“Yes,” you murmur, suddenly exhausted. “Thank you.”

“Do you want to talk about it?” he asks you, his eyes betraying a hint of worry for you.

“I, I just …” you trail off, your tongue feeling like lead. “It’s just so hard. I hate that this happens. I hate that I can’t avoid it. I hate that I have to deal with this - it doesn’t seem fair. It’s not fair.”

“I’m sorry,” he says, closing his eyes and leaning his forehead against yours. “Y/N, I’m so sorry.”

“Why are you sorry?”

“That I can’t do more for you. I don’t want to see you in pain - you don’t deserve it. You’re my boyfriend, and I love you. You make me so happy, and I hate that I can’t always do the same.”

A smile crosses your lips. “You do make me happy. You make me so, so happy.”

“But what about times like this, Y/N? Where you’re alone, and in pain?”

“You don’t need to worry about me, Steve. I’ve dealt with this myself so many times.”

“But what if I want to help you?”

You chuckle and lean your head against his chest. “You’re such a hero.”

“Is that such a bad thing?”

Author’s Note: Yay, first fic! If you liked this, and want to see me write something, specific, send me a request!

PRONOUNS: He/Him [trans male reader]

“Are you feeling better?” he asks you.

“Yes,” you murmur, suddenly exhausted. “Thank you.”

“Do you want to talk about it?” he asks you, his eyes betraying a hint of worry for you.

“I, I just …” you trail off, your tongue feeling like lead. “It’s just so hard. I hate that this happens. I hate that I can’t avoid it. I hate that I have to deal with this - it doesn’t seem fair. It’s not fair.”

“I’m sorry,” he says, closing his eyes and leaning his forehead against yours. “Y/N, I’m so sorry.”

“Why are you sorry?”

“That I can’t do more for you. I don’t want to see you in pain - you don’t deserve it. You’re my boyfriend, and I love you. You make me so happy, and I hate that I can’t always do the same.”

A smile crosses your lips. “You do make me happy. You make me so, so happy.”

“But what about times like this, Y/N? Where you’re alone, and in pain?”

“You don’t need to worry about me, Steve. I’ve dealt with this myself so many times.”

“But what if I want to help you?”

You chuckle and lean your head against his chest. “You’re such a hero.”

“Is that such a bad thing?”

Author’s Note: Yay, first fic! If you liked this, and want to see me write something, specific, send me a request!
trail.content_abstract:
TITLE: Breathe

WORD COUNT: 1061

PROMPT: hey man! Thanks so much for this. Could you write a Steve Rogers x trans male reader, maybe with the reader just feeling really shitty and dysphoria hitting them hard, and Steve helps them through it?

PRONOUNS: He/Him [trans male reader]

Your hand trembles as your fist closes around the handle of your door, conveying the unease that has consumed your mind since you awoke that morning. The unease, which has settled in your stomach like a bite of a fruit that wasn’t quite ripe yet, has prevented you from doing anything truly productive throughout the course of the day. The anxiety had build up inside you, as you knew (and still do know) that the answer is not if, but when.

You pass by a mirror in your front porch, catching a brief glance of your appearance. You pause, and then take a step back to review your appearance in more detail. Your reflection looks you back in the eye, and you take note of all your features. Your eyes, which have the same gleam of your father, framed by your face, which resembles that of your mother.

summary: THEY CALLED IT THE INCURSION: a crashing of realities that came together to make something new. We call it the beginning, the...
body:
THEY CALLED IT THE INCURSION: a crashing of realities that came together to make something new. We call it the beginning, the start of a world full of possibilities. Of heroes and gods. Of spies and mutants. Now in the aftermath we turn our eyes to the future for the danger isn’t over yet. The heroes can fight but some chaos refuses to be ruled and rumors of the titan Thanos have set everyone on edge.
                                                   Welcome to Earth-13130. The dangers are infinite.

       MAIN | ASK | OPEN CHARACTERS | MOST WANTED | NAVIGATION | PLOT

tags: vines are the only things keeping me living lol
summary: Peter quotes vines all the time while fighting and you can’t convince me otherwise. Sometime when he’s fighting with Tony, he...
body: Peter quotes vines all the time while fighting and you can’t convince me otherwise. Sometime when he’s fighting with Tony, he forgets that Tony has no idea what the hell vines are and like, when a bad guy tries tossing him a bomb or something, he goes ‘its an avocado, thaaanks’ or when he knocks one of them down, he’d be like ‘Miss Keisha? Oh my fucking god, she fuckin dead’ and like, if something goes wrong he just shouts ‘what the fuck richard’ meanwhile Tony’s just there like ???? who fucking raised you to swear like this?? what is ? Who’s richard?? The like, one day he sees a vine compilation in his recommended bc Peter will watch stuff while hanging out with Tony and he decides to watch it and finally understands why Peter randomly shouts ‘WHAT YOU MEAN ARKAN SAW”

tags: you're a millenial one of us you know what's going on
summary: The first time I read the name “Nick Fury” in an article I immediately pronounced it as “Nick Furry” in my head and I’m still...
body: The first time I read the name “Nick Fury” in an article I immediately pronounced it as “Nick Furry” in my head and I’m still sourly disappointed about how no one has taken the opportunity to slip this joke into the movies yet.
